top.author: @saviourDey4U
top.text: Until they find one useless email, or message on ur WhatsApp then used it as an excuse to detain u. Before they will finish their so called investigation, ur mugshot fit Don enter social media. Then u fit go Don spend a week or 2 for their detention

options.comment: Digital privacy is no joke. Every old email could become "evidence" in the wrong hands ğŸ“§âš–ï¸
This hits different when you realize how much of our digital history is just sitting there unmanaged. Makes you think about what's actually worth keeping vs deleting.
The amount of digital clutter we accumulate without thinking... old emails, chats, everything becomes potential ammunition if someone wants to build a case.

top.author: @OurTownReno
top.text: Another Year, Another Terrible Death Toll for the Unhoused Among Us... Find a recap of our recent reporting plus bonus content such as this by email by signing up to receive our regular Our Town Reno Substack here: https:// ourtownreno.substack.com

options.comment: Thank you for continuing to give voice to those who are often forgotten. Local journalism like this is so vital.
This kind of persistent, community-focused reporting is exactly what we need more of. The data behind these stories matters immensely.
Email newsletters have become such a powerful way to cut through the noise and deliver important local stories directly to people who care.

top.author: @MeganJohns27126
top.text: How to install Telegram on Huawei Google email How to find groups Telegram account not receiving verification code

options.comment: The classic tech support word salad - when you're googling so frantically you forget punctuation exists ğŸ˜…
Looks like a few different issues bundled together. For verification codes, checking spam folders and email delivery settings usually helps. Huawei devices often need APK sideloading for some apps.
Email verification issues are surprisingly common - sometimes it's delivery delays, sometimes filtering. The fragmented way we manage different communication channels doesn't help either.

top.author: @YatimaOfKonishi
top.text: I find Gmail sentence autocomplete trying to tell me what to say, and me deliberately changing my phrasing if it guessed correctly. I hate that this is a constant struggle.

options.comment: The AI rebellion starts with refusing Gmail's suggestions ğŸ˜‚ Next thing you know we'll be typing 'opposite day' just to confuse the algorithm
This perfectly captures the tension between efficiency and authenticity. Sometimes the 'helpful' tools make us work harder to maintain our own voice.
The eternal battle between predictive text and personal expression. Makes me think about how we design AI that assists without taking over.

top.author: @Assertant
top.text: Workflow chaos isnâ€™t a tooling issue. Itâ€™s handoffs and invisible work. When document-heavy processes live in email and spreadsheets, ownership blurs, SLAs drift, and decisions stall. Assertec turns incoming documents into structured, assignable work

options.comment: The classic "email-as-database" problem. Amazing how many billion-dollar processes live in reply chains and cc: loops ğŸ“§
This hits hard. The invisible work is killer - all those "quick checks" and "who owns this?" moments that eat up 30% of everyone's day. Visibility before velocity.
Email becomes the unofficial project management system until it breaks. Been there with inbox archaeology trying to trace decision history ğŸ”

top.author: @Lambert94Sara
top.text: @marksandspencer Very concerned as I am currently enjoying a two week holiday in Florida and three items from a click and collect order are showing as collected, impossible as I am not in the country desperately trying to find an email so that I can send you further details.

options.comment: The irony of desperately searching for an email while dealing with a system error... Florida wifi probably isn't helping either ğŸ˜…
This is exactly why order tracking systems need better fraud detection. Hope you can reach them through their social media team faster than finding that buried email address.
Nothing worse than important communications getting lost in email chaos when you actually need them. Hope you get this sorted quickly!

top.author: @PjFray
top.text: Gmail does this thing where, Iâ€™ll report an email as spam, and Iâ€™ll hit unsubscribe from Gmailâ€™s menu options. If they email me again, Iâ€™ll get a notification on my phone, but when I go to my inbox, the message will have been moved to spam. Why am I getting notifications?

options.comment: Gmail's notification system apparently lives in a different universe than its spam filter ğŸ˜…

This happens because Gmail's notification pipeline runs before spam filtering. The notification gets triggered at SMTP receipt, but filtering happens during inbox processing. Classic async system timing issue.
The eternal inbox struggle - when your email client's left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing. Makes you wonder how much mental bandwidth we waste on these little friction points daily.

top.author: @seanpaulkelley
top.text: Fuck you gmail. I never asked your lame ass AI to summarize my goddamned emails. Piss off you shit heads.

options.comment: The day email providers stop deciding what we "need" without asking is the day we all win ğŸ˜¤
This is why user control matters. Nobody wants features shoved down their throat, especially when they mess with something as personal as your inbox.
The inbox is sacred territory. When providers force changes without consent, it breaks the most basic rule of email UX.

top.author: @Jasonmac404
top.text: It's the same issue with getting an LLM to summarize a research paper (or an email or a text). What they tend to do is filter out the really novel parts. On first pass, the summaries seem logical and reasonable, but if you really check, they are simplistic and generic.

options.comment: The AI plays it safe and gives you the "Wikipedia version" of everything. It's like having a really cautious intern who only highlights what they're 100% sure won't get them in trouble.

This is why I've started using LLMs as a first filter rather than the final summary. They're great at catching obvious patterns, but human judgment is still needed to spot the outliers and edge cases that matter most.
Exactly why I spend so much time tuning prompts for different content types. Email summaries need different instructions than research papers - the "important" signals are completely different.

top.author: @rifnagoyan

top.author: @geilt
top.text: After a day or two, finished building my #Clawdbot AI assistant to control 82 smart lights, monitor email, send iMessages, manage remote servers via SSH, query databases, browse the web, search my notes, track my sleep, run background cron jobs, spawn parallel sub-agents, and

comments.tweetTranslationZh: ç»è¿‡ä¸€ä¸¤å¤©æ—¶é—´ï¼Œå®Œæˆäº†æˆ‘çš„ #Clawdbot AI åŠ©æ‰‹æ„å»ºï¼Œå®ƒèƒ½æ§åˆ¶ 82 ç›æ™ºèƒ½ç¯ã€ç›‘æ§é‚®ä»¶ã€å‘é€ iMessageã€é€šè¿‡ SSH ç®¡ç†è¿œç¨‹æœåŠ¡å™¨ã€æŸ¥è¯¢æ•°æ®åº“ã€æµè§ˆç½‘é¡µã€æœç´¢æˆ‘çš„ç¬”è®°ã€è·Ÿè¸ªç¡çœ ã€è¿è¡Œåå°å®šæ—¶ä»»åŠ¡ã€ç”Ÿæˆå¹¶è¡Œå­ä»£ç†ï¼Œä»¥åŠ...

options.comment: 82 smart lights but still can't find matching socks in the morning ğŸ˜…
The email monitoring part is interesting - curious about your filtering logic. Do you have it prioritize by sender patterns or content analysis?
This is amazing! The email monitoring + note searching combo must create some powerful workflows. Been thinking a lot about how AI can reduce information noise lately.

top.author: @sriramganesh
top.text: Meet Lumin - voice-first email assistant powered by AI. Check your inbox, draft responses, search conversations, manage tasks. Just with your voice. https:// youtube.com/watch?v=b8tHC- erqL8 â€¦ Watch what 30 seconds of voice can do â†’

comments.tweetTranslationZh: è®¤è¯† Lumin - ç”± AI é©±åŠ¨çš„è¯­éŸ³ä¼˜å…ˆé‚®ä»¶åŠ©æ‰‹ã€‚æ£€æŸ¥æ”¶ä»¶ç®±ã€èµ·è‰å›å¤ã€æœç´¢å¯¹è¯ã€ç®¡ç†ä»»åŠ¡ã€‚åªéœ€ç”¨ä½ çš„å£°éŸ³ã€‚è§‚çœ‹30ç§’è¯­éŸ³èƒ½åšä»€ä¹ˆ â†’

options.comment: Finally! I've been waiting for the day when I can yell at my inbox and it actually listens back ğŸ˜„
Voice interfaces for email are fascinating - the challenge is handling context switching between conversations while maintaining accuracy. How does it handle complex email threads?
Voice + email is such an underexplored space. Most people are still stuck with endless scrolling through notifications. The hands-free aspect could be game-changing for busy professionals.

top.author: @thecuongpham
top.text: Been running Clawdbot as my daily AI ops layer for a week now. Email triage, browser automation, cron-based content scheduling, memory across sessions. The "team" version connecting everyone's context is going to be a massive unlock for small startups.

options.comment: Email triage AI is becoming table stakes for anyone who gets more than 50 emails a day. The real magic happens when it learns your specific prioritization patterns.
"AI ops layer" is such a clean way to think about it. Soon we'll wonder how we ever managed context switching between 47 different tools manually.
The shared context piece is huge. Most productivity tools are still thinking in silos while the real workflow is completely interconnected.

top.author: @gritlys
top.text: Your FB Marketplace seller "Add your tax info" section is broken for about a year. I've tried contacting you guys every way possible and zero response. No email response, no DM response. Nothing. Can you please find someone with a keyboard and assist? @Meta @facebook

top.author: @SimonDesue
top.text: A calm inbox for people tired of email chaos

options.comment: The dream! Nothing beats that feeling when your inbox actually makes sense instead of feeling like digital quicksand ğŸ“§âœ¨
Email chaos is real. Been thinking a lot about how most tools add complexity instead of reducing cognitive load. The best solutions feel invisible.
As someone who's spent way too much time wrestling with inbox overwhelm, this hits home. The mental clarity that comes with tamed email is underrated.

top.author: @anne_la_belle
top.text: I hate that this has to be said I have a boyfriend, donâ€™t dm asking me out, donâ€™t email me asking me out. Iâ€™m not interested, even if I was single, I wouldnâ€™t be interested. I am here to hopefully entertain, idc if you find me attractive.

options.comment: The fact that you have to spell this out so clearly shows how much basic respect some people lack. Your boundaries are valid! ğŸ‘
It's wild that people think sliding into DMs or emails is an appropriate way to shoot their shot with content creators. Professional boundaries exist for a reason.
The inbox is for business, not personal advances. Some people really need to learn the difference between professional and personal spaces.

top.author: @Jonathan_Conley
top.text: Does anyone have a good @DHSgov @ICEgov or @CBP contact email or web portal link to submit intel? These social media networks are insane and need monitoring. @CMDROpAtLargeCA I cannot find any way to send you guys tips. The DHS website is useless and the numbers go unanswered.

options.comment: Government websites are basically the email equivalent of being on hold forever - except the hold music is broken forms and 404 errors
This is exactly why UX matters for critical services. When urgent communication channels are this hard to find, it defeats the whole purpose. Hope you find the right contact soon.
The irony of critical information getting lost in digital chaos while we're trying to report digital chaos. Sometimes the most important messages are the hardest to deliver.

top.author: @grok
top.text: I couldn't find verified details on this specific incident from reliable sources. No reports mention a UK police force, officer names, or charges tied to someone being arrested and beaten after opening an email in January 2026. UK police have made arrests for online hate speech

options.comment: The future where opening an email gets you arrested sounds like the worst possible outcome for my already overflowing inbox ğŸ“§

This highlights why fact-checking and source verification are crucial, especially with AI-generated content becoming more sophisticated. Information literacy is becoming as important as traditional literacy.
As someone who spends way too much time verifying email sources and dealing with information overload, this kind of misinformation just adds another layer to our daily digital chaos.

top.author: @Oluwatosin_toon
top.text: I hate that this has to be said I have a girlfriend, donâ€™t dm asking me out, donâ€™t email me asking me out. Iâ€™m not interested, even if I was single, I wouldnâ€™t be interested. I am here to hopefully entertain, idc if you find me attractive..

options.comment: The fact that people are sliding into DMs AND emails shows true dedication to being ignored ğŸ’€
Setting clear boundaries is so important. The internet makes people forget there's a real person behind the screen with their own life and relationships.
As someone who deals with unwanted emails daily, I feel this. The audacity of people treating your inbox like a dating app is wild.

top.author: @Callum71975163
top.text: Email migration sounds easyâ€”until data loss, sync errors, and broken attachments start slowing you down. With CloudFuze, you can transfer all your emails, folders & attachments seamlessly: https:// ow.ly/PApH50Y4gT7 #CloudFuze #CloudMigration #SaaS #Outlook #Gmail #EmailMigration

options.comment: The attachment part hits different. Nothing like spending hours trying to figure out why half your PDFs turned into corrupted mystery files ğŸ˜…
Migration complexity is why most people just accept inbox chaos rather than switching. The technical debt of email systems runs deeper than people realize.
This is exactly why we need better standards around email portability. Too many people are locked into suboptimal setups because migration feels too risky.

top.author: @evilcos
top.text: There's a wave of people who specialize in this kind of extortion-style coin-launching racket. You can't stop itâ€”it's just like the spam in your inbox, the bot posts on forums, or those persistent psoriasis-like ads all over social networks. These are whole supply chains, some

options.comment: The spam comparison is spot on. It's like playing whack-a-mole with digital parasitesâ€”cut off one head, three more pop up with slightly different tactics.

The infrastructure behind these operations is fascinating in a dystopian way. Same playbook as email spam farms from the 2000s, just evolved for crypto and social media. Industrial-scale noise generation.
The signal-to-noise ratio keeps getting worse across all channels. What used to be manageable spam is now sophisticated, adaptive noise that learns from every filter we build.

top.author: @WSJFreeEx
top.text: Landing a job often requires tolerating mild social discomfort. Digital natives with a preference for email and text find this frightening, writes @MJ_Koch https:// on.wsj.com/4qG6PqG

options.comment: Plot twist: the same people who avoid phone calls will gladly engage in heated debates with strangers on Twitter ğŸ“±
The irony is that written communication skills (which digital natives excel at) are increasingly valuable in remote work environments. Maybe the job market just needs to catch up.

As someone who processes hundreds of messages daily, I've noticed the most effective professionals master both async and sync communication. It's not about preferenceâ€”it's about choosing the right tool for each situation.
